mmud.database.entities.characters

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmud.database.entities.characters.Person
      • mmud.database.entities.characters.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AttributeWrangler, DisplayInterface, ItemWrangler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Administrator

    @Entity
public class User
extends Person
    A user in the game. Might be an administrator.
    Author:
    maartenl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPassword

        public String getPassword()

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(String password)
                 throws MudException
        Sets the password of the person. Can contain any character, but has to have at least size of 5. You cannot set a password this way, you can only set it for the first time, i.e. when creating a new character.
        Parameters:
        password - the new password.
        Throws:
        MudException - if the password is not allowed.

      • getLastlogin

        public Date getLastlogin()
        Returns the last time the user was logged in. Can return null, which means the user has never once logged on and is new. (or not a user)
        Returns:
        the date of last logged on.

      • getLastcommand

        public Date getLastcommand()
        Returns the last time that a command was issued. Used for determining idle time.
        Returns:
        the date of the last time a command was entered.

      • verifySessionPassword

        public boolean verifySessionPassword(String aSessionPassword)
        verify sessionpassword
        Parameters:
        aSessionPassword - the sessionpassword to be verified.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the sessionpassword provided is an exact match with the original sessionpassword.

      • activate

              throws MudException
        activate a character
        Parameters:
        address - the ip-address or hostname used by the player.
        Throws:
        MudException

      • generateSessionPassword

        public void generateSessionPassword()
        generate a session password to be used by player during game session. Use getLok() to return a String containing 25 random digits, capitals and smallcaps.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        deactivate a character (usually because someone typed quit.)

      • removeMacro

        public boolean removeMacro(String string)
        Removes a macro from the existing macros. Returns false if the removal failed (for instance if the macro did not exist.)
        Parameters:
        string - the name of the macro to remove
        Returns:
        true if success, otherwise false.

      • addMacro

        public void addMacro(Macro macro)
        Adds a macro to the list of macros. Will do nothing if the macro already exists.
        Parameters:
        macro - the macro to add.

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • removeAnnoyingUser

        public boolean removeAnnoyingUser(User aUser)
        Removes a user from the big ignore list. Assumedly, because he is no longer annoying.
        Parameters:
        aUser -
        Returns:
        true if the user was found, and successfully removed from the set.

      • isIgnoring

        protected boolean isIgnoring(Person aPerson)
        Whether or not you are ignoring a certain person. The default is that nobody is ignoring you.
        Overrides:
        isIgnoring in class Person
        Parameters:
        aPerson - the person to check in your ignore list.
        Returns:
        true if the person should be ignored, false otherwise.

      • getIdleTime

        public Long getIdleTime()
        Retrieves the idle time in minutes, i,e. between the last entered command and the current time. Returns null if the last command date/time is not available.
        Returns:
        Long containing minutes, or null.

      • isIdleTooLong

        public boolean isIdleTooLong()
        Check to see if the User was inactive for more than an hour.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the User was inactive (i.e. has not entered a command) for more than an hour.

      • getIdleTimeInMinAndSeconds

        public String getIdleTimeInMinAndSeconds()
        Returns the time that a user was inactive.
        Returns:
        String the number of minutes and seconds that the player has been idle in the following format: "(<min> min, <sec> sec idle)".
